title: of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 2 of the Road Traffic
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of 

Drivers) (Amendment) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on the 21st day of February 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited road traffic (licensing drivers) (amendment) regulation 2022 (2) regulation come operation 21st day february 2022

title: of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 2 of the Road Traffic
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic 

(Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean road traffic (licensing drivers) regulation 2006 (s.i no 537 2006)

title: of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 2 of the Road Traffic
heading: 3. Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations (amended by the deletion of
text_raw:
3. Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations (amended by the deletion of 
paragraph (2) by the European Union (Licensing of Drivers) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 52 of 2022)) is amended by the insertion of the 
following paragraph after paragraph (1) – 

“(2) A driving licence shall, subject to paragraph (3), be granted – 

(a) 

(b) 

in the case of an applicant who is less than 65 years of age on 
the commencement day, for a licence to drive vehicles of 
category A, A1, A2, AM, B, BE or W, for the period of 10 
years, 

in the case of an applicant who is less than 70 years of age on 
the commencement day, for a licence to drive vehicles of 
category C, CE, C1, C1E, D, DE, D1 or D1E, for the period 
of 5 years, 

(c) where the application is for a licence to drive vehicles of 
category A, A1, A2, AM, B, BE or W, and the applicant is, 
on the commencement day – 

(i) 

65 years of age or more, but less than 72 years of age, 
for the period beginning on the commencement day 
and ending on the day before the applicant attains the 
age of 75 years, or 

(ii) 72 years of age or more, for the period of 3 years, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 18th February, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [53] 3 

(d) where an application is for a licence to drive vehicles of 
category C, CE, C1, C1E, D, DE, D1 or D1E, and the 
applicant is, on the commencement day – 

(i) 

70 years of age or more, but less than 72 years of age, 
for the period beginning on the commencement day 
and ending on the day before the applicant attains the 
age of 75 years, or 

(ii) 72 years of age or more, for the period of 3 years.”.

title: of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 2 of the Road Traffic
heading: 4. Regulation 41(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
4. Regulation 41(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 

substitution of the following subparagraph for subparagraph (d): 

“(d) the applicant is or will be 75 years of age or more on the 
commencement day, or will attain the age of 75 years within 
3 months of the date of application,”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 15 February 2022 

HILDEGARDE NAUGHTON, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Transport 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [53]
text_norm: 4 regulation 41(1) principal regulation amended substitution following subparagraph subparagraph (d) (d) applicant 75 year age commencement day attain age 75 year within 3 month date application  given hand 15 february 2022 hildegarde naughton minister state department transport 4 53

title: of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 2 of the Road Traffic
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations raise the age from 70 to 75 for the mandatory provision of a 
medical report when applying for a learner permit or driving licence. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [53] 5
